meanings.definition: To delay or slow down the progress or development of something.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain was retarding our journey.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was retarding our arrival at the party.
meanings.sent3: The turtle's slow pace was retarding the race, much to the amusement of the spectators.
meanings.sent4: His constant interruptions were retarding the flow of the meeting like a stubborn dam.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog was retarding our visibility, making it hard to see the road ahead.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to slow down or hinder progress.
meanings.sent1: The retarding effect of the heavy backpack made him walk slower.
meanings.sent2: The retarding force of friction slowed down the moving car.
meanings.sent3: The retarding snail on the sidewalk was a funny sight to see.
meanings.sent4: Her retarding caution was like a red flag waving in front of progress.
meanings.sent5: The retarding impact of the bad weather made outdoor activities difficult.

meanings.definition: The act of slowing down or hindering progress.
meanings.sent1: The retarding of the project was due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The retarding of the train caused delays for all passengers.
meanings.sent3: The little monkey's playful antics were a cute form of retarding.
meanings.sent4: The retarding of time seemed to stretch the moment into eternity.
meanings.sent5: The retarding of the growth of the plants puzzled the gardeners.
